data.title: What's Peeps Thinking About Now? It's Probably Random!
data.meta_description: Posts about Neil Patrick Harris written by Anthony Peoples
data.meta_site_name: What's Peeps Thinking About Now?  It's Probably Random!
data.text:
Winter is winding down and spring is now just over a week away.

In Central Illinois, we experienced a spring-like day earlier this week with a high of 70Â° and snow is expected this weekend.

Speaking of the weekend, enjoy yours and thank you for checking out my thoughts.

XANADU â€” THE FIRST TWO WEEKS

Last week, I shared that Iâ€™m now a â€œDog Dadâ€ again and I introduced you to #Pug2023 â€” Xanadu.

Sheâ€™s had more wins than losses in the potty training process, but thatâ€™s because Iâ€™m watching her like a hawk when sheâ€™s inside.

In the two weeks since Iâ€™ve had her, sheâ€™s gained one-and-a-half pounds and now weighs six pounds!

She also experienced her first snow (less than an inch) after a rainy day with near hurricane-force winds!

And, she was intrigued by the cold of the ice and enjoyed licking it!

Itâ€™s incredible how, like a baby, everything she sees goes into her mouth outside! And, I guess thereâ€™s an upside to her biting â€” she allows my fingers in her mouth to take everything out that she picks up!

Xanadu is becoming much more sociable to people and to the select dogs Iâ€™m letting her near until sheâ€™s fully vaccinated.

WHY EVEN BOTHER WATCHING?

There are so many streaming services out there, with Netflix being the biggest, and many create its own original content.

And, then if they donâ€™t get â€œGame of Thronesâ€ or â€œOzarkâ€ viewership numbers, they cancel the series after just a season or two.

This is never more apparent that now. So, my question is, why even bother investing time into a new series that wonâ€™t have a conclusion?

â€œUNCOUPLEDâ€ LIVES!

This happened to the Netflix series â€œUncoupledâ€ that I watched last summer.

It was cancelled on a cliffhanger after one season. Luckily, it was picked up by Showtime.

If you havenâ€™t watched it, hereâ€™s what I wrote about it:

â€œNeil Patrick Harris leads this eight-episode, Netflix series, alongside Tisha Campbell, Tuc Williams, and Marcia Gay Harden. This is the show that got me to thinking about my life.

Michael and his boyfriend have been together 17 years and heâ€™s planning a surprise 50th birthday party for his partner. However, itâ€™s Michael that gets the biggest surprise right before he and Colin walk into the party. Colin tells him that heâ€™s moving out!

The series is very funny, sexy, and naughty!

The one thing I didnâ€™t like was Michaelâ€™s excessive whining and crying about moving on without Colin.

Donâ€™t get me wrong! I shed tears after my marriage fell apart, but life goes on!

Itâ€™s so great seeing Campbell again, even though sheâ€™s been actively working since 1990s â€œMartinâ€. She plays Michaelâ€™s real estate agent colleague and friend Suzanne.â€

GRADE: B+

â€œMARCH MADNESSâ€

While spring officially begins Monday, March 20th, itâ€™s â€œSelection Sundayâ€ weekend for the NCAA menâ€™s basketball tournament.

I might wager $10 this year and put forth my brackets for â€œMarch Madnessâ€ at work.

In 2013, I was successful in picking Louisville beating Michigan in the finals.

Not only did I win $144 at work, but I also won a 55â€³ wide screen television from a local store in the Quad Cities. And, it still works!

MY OSCAR PICKS

The Academy Awards are Sunday night.

Here are my picks in the big categories â€” who will win, who might win, and who I want to win!

Best Picture: I have it narrowed down to three: â€œAll Quiet on the Western Frontâ€, â€œEverything Everywhere All at Onceâ€, and â€œTÃ¡râ€.

WILL WIN: â€œEVERYTHING EVERYWHERE ALL AT ONCEâ€œ

MIGHT WIN: â€œALL QUIET ON THE WESTERN FRONTâ€

I WANT TO WIN: â€œTARâ€ OR â€œEVERYTHING EVERYWHERE ALL AT ONCEâ€

Best Director: My final two are Daniel Kwan, Daniel Scheinert (â€œEverything Everywhere All at Onceâ€) or Steven Spielberg (â€œThe Fabelmansâ€)

WHO WILL WIN: THE DANIELS

WHO MIGHT WIN: SPIELBERG

WHO I WANT TO WIN: THE DANIELS

Best Lead Actor: My two final choices are Austin Butler (â€œElvisâ€) and Brendan Fraser (â€œThe Whaleâ€)

WHO WILL WIN: FRASER

WHO MIGHT WIN: BUTLER

WHO I WANT TO WIN: NOT COMMITTED SINCE I HAVENâ€™T SEEN â€œTHE WHALEâ€ YET.

Best Lead Actress: My finalists are Cate Blanchett (â€œTÃ¡râ€) and Michelle Yeoh (â€œEverything Everywhere All at Onceâ€)

WHO WILL WIN: YEOH

WHO MIGHT WIN: BLANCHETT

WHO I WANT TO WIN: A TIE â€” YEOH AND BLANCHETT BOTH GETTING OSCARS!

Best Supporting Actor:

WILL WIN & WANT TO WIN: Ke Huy Quan (â€œEverything Everywhere All at Onceâ€)

Best Supporting Actress: Iâ€™ve narrowed it down to Angela Bassett (â€œBlack Panther: Wakanda Foreverâ€) and Jamie Lee Curtis (â€œEverything Everywhere All at Onceâ€)

WHO WILL WIN & WANT TO WIN: CURTIS

WHO MIGHT WIN: BASSETT

Best Adapted Screenplay: My finalists are â€œAll Quiet on the Western Frontâ€ and â€œWomen Talkingâ€

WHO WILL WIN & WANT TO WIN: â€œALL QUIET ON THE WESTERN FRONTâ€

WHO MIGHT WIN: â€œWOMEN TALKINGâ€

Best Original Screenplay: My finalists are â€œEverything Everywhere All at Onceâ€ and â€œTÃ¡râ€

WILL WIN & WANT TO WIN: â€œEVERYTHING EVERYWHERE ALL AT ONCEâ€

Best Original Song: This is no contest and Iâ€™d be shocked if â€œNaatu Naatuâ€ doesnâ€™t win!

â€œApplauseâ€ from â€œTell It Like a Womanâ€

â€œHold My Handâ€ from â€œTop Gun: Maverickâ€

â€œLift Me Upâ€ from â€œBlack Panther: Wakanda Foreverâ€

â€œNaatu Naatuâ€ from â€œRRRâ€

â€œThis Is a Lifeâ€ from â€œEverything Everywhere All at Onceâ€

WILL WIN & I WANT TO WIN: â€œNAATU NAATUâ€

â€œEVERYTHING EVERYWHERE ALL AT ONCEâ€

Typically, this would not be my kind of movie.

I watched it last December because of the awards seasons buzz and I love Michelle Yeoh. (Yes, Iâ€™m crying because we may never see the sequels to â€œCrazy Rich Asiansâ€.)

The movie has already picked up the equivalent of â€œBest Pictureâ€ at the Criticsâ€™ Choice Awards and the Screen Actors Guild Awards and Yeoh has already won about three dozen Best Actress awards with the Oscars coming down to her and Cate Blanchett.

Ke Hu Quan, who plays Yeohâ€™s husband, is almost a shoe-in for the Oscar, and Jamie Lee Curtis earned her first Academy Award nomination for the movie in the Best Supporting Actress category.

While the movie ended up being my #6 movie of 2022, Iâ€™m so ready to watch it again just to see what I missed the first time since it was so mind-blowing!

GRADE: A-

Iâ€™M SO IN LOVE WITH MICHELLE YEOH

Iâ€™ve been singing the praises of â€œCrazy Rich Asiansâ€ for years.

When I saw the movie in August 2018, I gave it an â€œAâ€ calling it â€œa classic romantic comedy â€” a masterpiece of not only love, but culture.â€ in a blog titled, â€˜â€œCrazy Rich Asiansâ€ Sparkles â€” Fascinating & Irresistibleâ€â€˜.

In that piece, I called Michelle Yeoh â€œageless and gorgeousâ€. And, now that beauty graces the new â€œPeopleâ€ magazine.

The accompanying article on Yeoh is incredible â€” just hearing in her own words about the battles and stereotypes sheâ€™s been fighting since coming to Hollywood!

While I showed the cover because itâ€™s beautiful, I also featured it because of the emerald ring from â€œCrazy Rich Asiansâ€. Itâ€™s actually her ring and wasnâ€™t just a movie prop!

However, hereâ€™s my favorite photo from the â€œPeopleâ€ article.

Now, just give her the Best Actress Oscar already (and if youâ€™re reading this after Sunday night, youâ€™ll know if the Academy Awards did just that)!

â€œYOU PEOPLEâ€

With a cast led by eight-time Emmy Award winner Julia Louis-Dreyfus and Emmy winner and Oscar nominee Eddie Murphy, how could you go wrong? Well, pretty easily!

The romantic-comedy movie is about race. Broker and podcaster Ezra (Jonah Hill), who is Jewish, meets and falls in love with fashion designer Amira (Lauren London), who is Black.

Dreyfus plays Ezraâ€™s mother who tries too hard to show how thrilled she is by having a future daughter-in-law thatâ€™s Black. Meanwhile, Murphy doesnâ€™t try hard enough to hide his feelings about having a white Jewish son-in-law.

While Louis-Dreyfus was great, the standouts in the movie were London and Sam Jay, who plays Mo, Ezraâ€™s podcast sidekick, whoâ€™s a Black lesbian.

One of my favorite actors, David Duchovny, is pretty much wasted in this movie â€” not drunk-wasted, just no real purpose in the movie.

GRADE: C-

THATâ€™S IT

With all the craziness in the world, make it the best in your little part of it!

Anthony

Itâ€™s Friday so that means Iâ€™m ready to share a few things with you and the first one is personal! Shock!

Thank you for checking out my thoughts and have a great weekend.

SINGLE LIFE <INSERT YOUR DESCRIPTION HERE>

I recently watched a Netflix series that really spoke to me. It made me think a lot about my single life and the past five years and what needs to change over the next five years.

In last Decemberâ€™s Christmas letter, I stated, â€œIâ€™m still single and the dating life is, wait, what dating life? Good thing I enjoy my own company!â€

In early 2017, my ex and I decided to end our eight-year relationship.

While that relationship was played out in public through social media and this blog, when I finally opened up about our break-up months later, I wrote, â€œIf and when another relationship comes our way, we both might be more reserved to make it publicâ€¦â€

Well, I did.

However, I think the wires got crossed somewhere between that comment and Cupid. I still want to go on dates and if something real presents itself, Iâ€™m more than willing to take the plunge!

So, if you happen to have a face to face with Aphrodite, tell her we need to have a glass of wine and talk!

Until that happens, hereâ€™s the amazing Kylie Minogue with â€œAll The Loversâ€ from the â€œAphrodite Tourâ€! Watch this just the beautiful theatrics! ğŸ™‚

On second thought, if I have the chance to see Kylie live in concert in 2023, Iâ€™d put off love for another year! But, then again, why canâ€™t I have both? ğŸ™‚

â€œUNCOUPLEDâ€

Neil Patrick Harris leads this eight-episode, Netflix series, alongside Tisha Campbell, Tuc Williams, and Marcia Gay Harden. This is the show that got me to thinking about my life.

Michael and his boyfriend have been together 17 years and heâ€™s planning a surprise 50th birthday party for his partner. However, itâ€™s Michael that gets the biggest surprise right before he and Colin walk into the party. Colin tells him that heâ€™s moving out!

The series is very funny, sexy, and naughty!

The one thing I didnâ€™t like was Michaelâ€™s excessive whining and crying about moving on without Colin.

Donâ€™t get me wrong! I shed tears after my marriage fell apart, but life goes on!

Itâ€™s a lot different moving on in Panama City (FL), Duluth (MN), and Decatur (IL) than it is in New York City, where thereâ€™s a buffet of hot men to choose from! Yes, they probably have a buffet of issues, as well, just like those in Panama City, Duluth, and Decatur! ğŸ™‚

And, I loved that one of Michaelâ€™s best friends is a television â€œweathermanâ€. When they were talking, he makes a comment Michael didnâ€™t like and Michael ends the phone call with this zinger!

Itâ€™s so great seeing Campbell again, even though sheâ€™s been actively working since 1990s â€œMartinâ€. She plays Michaelâ€™s real estate agent colleague and friend Suzanne.

Hereâ€™s hoping for a renewal for a second season soon!

GRADE: B+

â€œTHE BLACK PHONEâ€

This summer blockbuster hit theaters in late June and is now on Peacock.

The $17 million Blumhouse Productions horror/supernatural thriller now has a box office take of $155.6 million!

It takes place in the same time frame as the original â€œHalloweenâ€ movie â€” 1978 â€” in North Denver, Colorado, where several young boys go missing and the police search for â€œThe Grabberâ€. (Yes, there are some winks to the John Carpenter classic!)

Ethan Hawke is creepy and great as the masked villain in the movie. And, young stars Mason Thames and Madeleine McGraw, as siblings Finney and Gwen, are incredible.

Since I was a kid about Finneyâ€™s age in 1978, the premise of the movie seemed very real and scary.

Discussions are underway on a sequel.

GRADE: A-

MORE â€œLOVERSâ€

Since Kylie Minogueâ€™s â€œAll The Loversâ€ was my second favorite song in the second era of my life (1999-2021), hereâ€™s the steamy and erotic official video!

â€œTHE SHIELDâ€

So, it only took two decades, but I finally watched the cutting edge FX series, â€œThe Shieldâ€, that ran from 2002-2008.

While I wonâ€™t blatantly give away detailed spoilers, Iâ€™ll speak freely because itâ€™s been twenty years and youâ€™ve probably watched it if you wanted to! ğŸ™‚

After watching this 88-episode series and seeing Vic Mackey (Michael Chiklis) getting away with his dirty deeds all the time, it made me think of â€œDallasâ€. How did people keep watching that snake J.R. Ewing be so nasty and hardly ever having to pay for his actions?

I wish the series had explored more about the cat strangulation and Julienâ€™s gayness later in the series. It just went away!

My favorite characters were Claudette (CCH Pounder), Danny (Catherine Dent), and Shane Vendrell (Walton Goggins). My least favorite characters were Julien and Shaneâ€™s wife, Mara.

I loved the guest starring roles with Oscar nominee Glenn Close and Oscar winner Forest Whitaker!

By far, the sexiest series regular was was Ronnie Gardocki (David Rees Snell). I love how he went from a regular looking Joe in season one to a stud in future seasons!

And, Guillermo Beltran in the final season was so hot! He was played by Italian Francesco Quinn, the son of actor Anthony Quinn.

Hereâ€™s a shocking story: Quinn died of an apparent heart attack in Malibu, in 2011, at the age of 48!

And, we canâ€™t forget the short stint with Alex Oâ€™Loughlin!

One last note about the worthwhile series â€” the finale with Shane â€” WOW!

GRADE: B

â€œTHE UNDOINGâ€

As you know, I absolutely love Nicole Kidman.

She was fantastic in this 2020 six-episode HBO thriller with Hugh Grant from creator and writer David E. Kelley.

The acting was spectacular and even earned Donald Sutherland a Criticsâ€™ Choice Television Award for Best Supporting Actor in a Limited Series or TV Movie.

One of the funniest lines in the bleak show was used twice by a lawyer that was hired by the family.

After she stated something, someone said something to the effect of â€œyouâ€™re kiddingâ€ and she replied both times, â€œI donâ€™t make jokes. Iâ€™m not funny!â€

GRADE: B

THATâ€™S IT

With all the craziness in the world, make it the best in your little part of it!

Anthony

You know I love to share with you and I use my blog and my writing as therapy.

Whether itâ€™s humorous, about the entertainment world, politics, or equality, the topics are usually random. You never know what Iâ€™ll write about next.

I started the blog in January 2012 and, before that, I joined Facebook in the spring of 2009. It was right after Ray and I started seeing each other.

So, over the past eight years, our lives were played out in the public arena. Itâ€™s given us the chance to meet some of you and to â€œfriendâ€ many others that we never met in person. However, youâ€™re still a part of our lives and we were a part of yours.

You saw everything from the fun meals and drinks we made, our holiday celebrations, our vacations, and our beautiful wedding reception (six years ago)!

As you know, I moved to Florida in early May and I havenâ€™t been shy about it not being an enjoyable experience. Part of that is the area, but the larger problem lies with me.

In a couple of blogs this spring (which Iâ€™m sharing again below), I said, â€œI lost faith in myself and in my fellow man and now, itâ€™s up to me to find it againâ€ after the 2016 presidential election.

In another blog, I wrote, â€œChange is stressful. Change is exciting. Change is different. Change is simply change!â€ and â€œIn life, we go through it many times. Whether itâ€™s losing loved ones through death, break-ups or divorce, or just by spreading our wings to fly, change proves weâ€™re alive.â€

The reasons for the change and the move I expressed in the blogs were honest, but I didnâ€™t share everything. Some of you sensed there was more to the story and there is.

In early February, Ray and I decided to go our separate ways after eight years together. We called it â€œa breakâ€. But, we knew then that we had drifted apart and the circumstances werenâ€™t going to change.

When I said, Florida â€œhasnâ€™t been an enjoyable experienceâ€, now you know the real, larger issue.

Moving here was a quick fix solution to our problem, a â€œband-aidâ€ to cover something that needed more attention, but was neglected.

In retrospective, Florida is/was a mistake. If I had it to do over again, I probably would have stayed in the Quad Cities, even as we moved forward with our separation and divorce.

After we started posting pictures of our trip to Scandinavia, we knew it was time to make it public based on comments of how happy we looked and it was good to see us together again.

That trip was already scheduled and paid for long before we made this life-altering decision. The trip turned out to be our â€œswan songâ€!

Ray is moving on with his life and is experiencing things he was missing out on in the last years of our relationship. Now, itâ€™s up to me to do the same.

I wish him the very best in life and I hope he finds what we had for much of our time together and lost toward the end.

On Kygoâ€™s 2016 CD, â€œCloud Nineâ€, thereâ€™s a song, â€œStole the Showâ€ that sadly and perfectly sums things up. Our relationship was on display thanks to social media and we didnâ€™t mind. But, now that the outcome is what it is, things playing out publicly is different.

If and when another relationship comes our way, we both might be more reserved to make it public and I hope, my friends, that you donâ€™t take that the wrong way.

Here are those blogs I referenced above:

â€œIt All Starts With Meâ€

https://anthonypeoples.wordpress.com/2017/04/07/it-all-starts-with-me/

â€œChangeâ€

https://anthonypeoples.wordpress.com/2017/04/15/change/

All of this has me thinking of the most charming public couple, Neil Patrick Harris and his husband, David Burtka.

In a 2014 â€œRolling Stoneâ€ feature on Harris, Burtka said, â€œThere is a lot of â€˜Oh, you guys are role modelsâ€™, Iâ€™m superhappy that people look to us. If anything happened, God forbid, I wouldnâ€™t want to let anyone down. But nothing will! After you get to, like, seven, eight years, itâ€™s like, â€˜No oneâ€™s going anywhereâ€™.â€

For Harris, Burtka, and their twins, Iâ€™m happy that itâ€™s true for them!

Anthony

The weekend is almost here and I hope you have fun plans.

The nice thing is that temperatures will be near 70Â° for Iowa and Illinois. If you recall by this time last year, the Quad Cities had already had its first measurable snow of the season! (0.4â€³ fell on October 22, 2013, in Moline, Illinois.)

Yes, I have a few random thoughts to share and I hope you enjoy reading them.

EBOLA FEARS & BLAME

As of now, one person has died here in the United States from Ebola, a disease that has killed close to 5,000 people in Africa. However, the World Health Organization says that the true number may be three times that official number.

Twice recently, while traveling, I had the unfortunate experience of watching Fox News in the hotel room and I was disgusted that the talking heads were blaming President Obama for not doing enough.

Maybe they need to step back for a moment and look at this fact!

If you think thatâ€™s just some Democratic, liberal slant of the facts, read a full article that I blogged about that in July 2012.

https://anthonypeoples.wordpress.com/2012/07/05/president-reagan-i-no-longer-hate-you/

REBA IS READY FOR A COMEBACK

Itâ€™s sad to say that when you have more Top Ten hits on the country chart than any other woman in history and youâ€™re tied with Dolly Parton with the most #1 country songs by a woman that youâ€™re staging a comeback, but thatâ€™s what Reba McEntire, my idol, is doing.

Rebaâ€™s last album, â€œAll The Women I Amâ€ was released almost four years ago and it featured her last #1 song, Turn On The Radioâ€, which topped the chart on New Yearâ€™s Day in 2011.

Hereâ€™s Reba performing that song in Moline in October 2011.

Since then, the next three singles faltered at country radio peaking at #22 (the remake of Beyonceâ€™s â€œIf I Were A Boyâ€), #40, and #44. Thanks country radio!

Nevertheless, sheâ€™s back with a new label and sheâ€™s making new music.

Earlier this week, Reba announced that she signed with Nash ICON Music, a joint venture between Big Machine Label Group (Taylor Swiftâ€™s label) and Cumulus Media, the broadcasting giant that owns 460 AM and FM stations in the United States.

Reba is working with her longtime friend and producer Tony Brown, whoâ€™s behind her biggest hits albums from the early-to-mid-1990s including my favorites, â€œRumor Has Itâ€ (1990) and â€œRead My Mindâ€ (1994). James Stroud is also co-producing the album. Stroud has produced some of Clay Walker and Tracy Lawrenceâ€™s biggest hits.

Reba has already

While thereâ€™s no date set for the new single and new album, Reba promises it will be â€œsoonâ€!

â€œGONE GIRLâ€

The latest David Fincher masterpiece, â€œGone Girlâ€, is amazing.

The movie is based on the New York Times best seller and critically acclaimed novel of the same name by former â€œEntertainment Weeklyâ€ writer Gillian Flynn.

In just three weeks, the movie starring Ben Affleck, Rosamund Pike, and Neil Patrick Harris has grossed more than $216 million worldwide with more than one-half of that domestically.

While I plan on reading the book in early December, the movie was incredible. It really helped that Flynn also wrote the screenplay for the movie.

Hereâ€™s the trailer, which tells you what you really need to know about the movie.

Affleck was very solid just as he was in â€œArgoâ€ and Pike definitely has a future in Hollywood.

Harris is so versatile as an actor and this is one of his most revealing and vulnerable, naked performances heâ€™s given.

Letâ€™s just say that he was definitely acting on Broadway in his critically acclaimed role in â€œHedwig and the Angry Inchâ€, because there is much more there!!!!!!!!!!!!! Okay, thatâ€™s my way of saying you see more of Harris in this movie than youâ€™ve ever seen before! ğŸ™‚

GRADE: A

WEâ€™RE HEADING TO THE CHAPEL AND WEâ€™RE GOING TO GET MARRIEDâ€¦

Marriage equality is sweeping the nation as court challenges and the Supreme Court of the United States are giving more Americans the freedom to get married.

Yet, that idiot and Fox News mouthpiece Mike Huckabee, the failed Presidential candidate, will not let it drop.

Check out this tweet and a Twitter response to his assessment of what Jesus probably thought.

While that might have offended some, that wasnâ€™t my intent. However, it made me smile and I couldnâ€™t have said it any better.

PARIS AND TEL AVIV HIGHLIGHTS

Last week, I turned the big 5-0 and we saved our pennies and dollars and celebrated the milestone birthday with a trip to Europe (Paris, France) and the Middle East (Tel Aviv, Israel).

Here are some of the interesting things we experienced on the trip.

My birthday present from Ray was dinner cruise on the Seine River, followed by a trip to the Eiffel Tower at night. We paid the extra 12 Euros to go to top and it was amazing to see the sprawled out city of Paris twinkling in the distance.

And, the night didnâ€™t end there. It was then off to the historic Moulin Rouge for a show and champagne. I actually turned 50 during the show.

Thanks Ray!!!!!!! Youâ€™re incredible.

We also had duck and goose a couple of times and while Iâ€™ll not make it a regular part of my eating habits, it was rather tasty.

The oddest thing I saw in Paris was a Chinese buffet near our hotel that we kept eyeing on our walks. We finally gave it a try and you actually had to microwave your food that was sitting out on the buffet! I wasnâ€™t a fan of that. Osaka Buffet in Moline, you have nothing to worry about!

But, then again, who goes to Paris and has a Chinese buffet?

Itâ€™s a small world after all. As we were waiting in the line to go through customs at Charles de Gaulle Airport in Paris, all of a sudden I heard â€œHey Molineâ€ and it was a sweet little, older couple that was coming back from a European River Cruise. You never know who or where youâ€™ll see your peeps! ğŸ™‚

Then it was off to Tel Aviv for three days.

Itâ€™s absolutely gorgeous there and from our hotel room, we could see the sandy beaches of the Mediterranean Sea!

We were amazed at how beautiful, healthy, and in shape most Israeli men are. Note to self: eat better and work out more!

The morning Israeli breakfast our hotel, Prima City Hotel, was very tasty. However, our favorite meal was at ×‘× ×™-×”×“×™×™×’, which translates to Benny The Fisherman, right on the Sea.

That was just the salads and â€œstartersâ€ that they brought out. Yes, fifteen of them, including the bread basket!

Incredible! I wanted to go back again, but we didnâ€™t.

TEL AVIV SCARE

Sadly, we didnâ€™t get our a stamp on our passport from Israel.

The customs agent was so flustered from ranting a woman in front of us for sticking her passport in her mouth that he forgot. He refused to let her go through his line because he wasnâ€™t going to touch her passport. And, I really donâ€™t blame him. However, his approach was a little abrasive.

As for us, our only scare was when we happened upon the U.S. Embassy in Tel Aviv on the way to dinner. It was dusk and we decided to take a picture of it for our photo album.

However, three guards came out (one with a large weapon) and told us not to take pictures and took my driverâ€™s license and called it in since we werenâ€™t carrying our passports. After a very long five minutes or so, they let us go and told us not to take pictures.

Itâ€™s very interesting because last month in Ottawa, Canadaâ€™s capital, the guards there had no issue with photo-taking tourists.

And, on our return flight home, the snow-covered Alps were beautiful!

PICK HIT

While in Tel Aviv, Israel, I was delighted that VH-1 showed music videos all the time. There was no filler programming or reality crap, just real videos like in the old days of MTV and VH-1.

I fell in love with the song, â€œStolen Danceâ€ by the German pop/rock/folk duo, Milky Chance, made up of singer Clemens Rehbein and DJ Philipp Dausch.

What I was surprised to learn is that the song is #1 on the Billboard Alternative Songs chart (six weeks) and #1 on the Rock Airplay chart (four weeks) in the United States.

And, itâ€™s already topped the charts in Austria, Belgium, the Czech Republic, France, Ireland, and Switzerland, and it peaked at #2 or #3 in Australia, Germany, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Slovakia, and Sweden.

So far, it isnâ€™t a Top 40 hit on mainstream radio in the U.S., but itâ€™s catching on.

THE CALENDAR SAYS HALLOWEEN, BUTâ€¦

Iâ€™m already in the Christmas spirit.

However, I plan on watching â€œHellbentâ€, a gay horror movie, from the people who brought us â€œHalloweenâ€ and â€œThe Nightmare on Elm Streetâ€. Itâ€™s a movie that I watch every October.

Now, back to Christmas. There are many upcoming holiday releases coming out including LeAnn Rimes, Darius Rucker, and Earth, Wind, & Fire.

But, Iâ€™ve already bought two new CDs.

I just got Idina Menzelâ€™s â€œHoliday Wishesâ€ this week.

While I believe that â€œBaby, Itâ€™s Cold Outsideâ€ is a tired Christmas song and itâ€™s becoming one of my least favorites, Idinaâ€™s version with sexy crooner Michael Buble, is fun and enjoyable.

Other standouts on the disc are â€œSilent Nightâ€, â€œHolly Jolly Christmasâ€, her remake of the Joni Mitchell classic, â€œRiverâ€, and the aforementioned duet with Buble.

I admit that it did take several listens to her version of the Mariah Carey classic, â€œAll I Want For Christmas Is Youâ€, before I could like and appreciate it. Careyâ€™s version is perfect!

It wasnâ€™t Menzelâ€™s voice that threw me for a loop. The arrangement is all over the place and the song is over five minutes long. Once I â€œgot itâ€, the song was more enjoyable.

GRADE: B+

And, another one you definitely need to add to your Christmas music collection is actor, singer, producer, writer, and Oscar host Seth MacFarlane, â€œHoliday For Swingâ€.

He has an amazing voice and brings an old-time Rat Pack feel to Christmas on â€œHoliday For Swingâ€. If you love jazz and Christmas music, youâ€™ll love it.

Sadly, there are no snippets that I can find online to share with you. Whatâ€™s up with that, Seth?

Iâ€™ve listened to the album countless times and it could definitely become a standard!

GRADE: A

THATâ€™S IT FOR NOW!

AIRLINE THREATS ARE NOT FUNNY

Before the 1970s, it was a much different world when it came to flying. High profile plane hijacking changed the rather lax airport security.

I remember seeing a cartoon during my childhood of a man raising his hand to his friend and yelling â€œHi Jackâ€ before being arrested.

After the terrorist attacks on the United States on 9/11, itâ€™s hard to imagine anyone making a joke of threatening an airline, an airport, or a plane.

However, last Sunday night, it happened when a 14-year-old Dutch girl, â€œSarahâ€, sent a threatening tweet to American Airlines.

Once she realized that this was turning into a big deal with the police involved, she tweeted, â€œI was joking and it was my friend not me, take her IP address not mine. Iâ€™m so scared Iâ€™m just a 14-year-old white girl Iâ€™m not a terrorist.â€ She was arrested the next day!

I have two things to say about this. I donâ€™t care how old someone is when they threaten to bomb a plane. Itâ€™s not a joke and they should be punished to the fullest extent of the law.

Secondly, if this tweet is proven to be sent by a â€œ14-year-old white girl who is not â€œa terroristâ€, sheâ€™s truly offensive. Implying that a â€œwhite girlâ€ couldnâ€™t possibly be a â€œterroristâ€ is racist!

Sadly, the only leeway Iâ€™ll give her on that one is immaturity, but even a teenager should know that the tweet would cause fear in some people and that is terrorism!

Incredibly, this has caused a rash of similar copycat tweets to American and other airlines. Real threats or not, this is just mind-boggling!

Even Miss Kansas 2013, Theresa Vail, is tattooed with the Serenity Prayer and a military medical insignia. She says, â€œIf I were crowned Miss America, bearing my tattoos, do you realize the stereotypes and stigmas it would break?â€

More women than men and Hispanics more than whites or blacks have body art.

Two years ago this week, I join the group of white men in their 40s to get a tattoo. It was a painful, almost four-hour process and Iâ€™m very happy to sport it and show it off.

â€œOUT OF THE FURNACEâ€

Christian Bale is one of the best actors in the movie business today.

â€œOut of The Furnaceâ€ is a little seen movie that came out about a week before his Oscar-nominated role in â€œAmerican Hustleâ€.

In the movie, Bale plays Russell Baze, a West Virginia steel mill worker that has a beautiful girlfriend (Zoe Saldana) that wants to have a baby, a brother (Casey Affleck) with a gambling problem and is struggling with life after serving in the war, and a dying father.

He works every day and is paying off his little brotherâ€™s gambling debts. After stopping for a few drinks after work one night, heâ€™s involved in an accident that changes his life forever.

Also, his little brother disappears and Russell feels itâ€™s up to him to find out what happened and to make things right.

The movie features incredible performances from Bale, Affeck, Saldana, and Woody Harrelson as a New Jersey sociopathic, inbreed, drug dealer named Harlan DeGroat.

THE DOWN SIDE TO BEING VISIBLE

While the LGBT (lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender) community continues to gain visibility, support, and equality across the United States and other countries at incredible rates, itâ€™s coming with a price.

Gay bashing has always been a problem.

Beatings and harassment at the hands of police prompted the historic â€œStonewall Riotsâ€ in June 1969 (I blogged about this last Gay Pride and Iâ€™ll provide the link below for those of you unfamiliar with it).

I remember standing outside the gay bar and sitting by the Riverfront in Paducah, Kentucky, with my friends back in the mid-1980s and rednecks would drive by making crude comments and hurling the derogatory f-word at us and on a few occasions, theyâ€™d even threaten us with baseball bats.

But, that was about 30 years ago and youâ€™d think people would be more educated and more accepting today. Many are, but thereâ€™s still a long road to travel.

The National Coalition of Anti-Violence Programs reports that violence toward gays in New York City was up 4% last year over 2011. And, the number of gay bashing reports have doubled this year. In May alone, there were 10 reported anti-gay attacks in the Big Apple, including the shooting death of 32-year-old Mark Carson on May 17th in the West Village.

And, itâ€™s not confined the countryâ€™s largest city. In Ohio, â€œOutlook Columbusâ€ reports that three gay men were beaten in separate attacks in the college town in the past week, including Christopher Ashcraft, who was visiting from Kentucky.

He told police that several men approached him asking for a jump-start. When he got his keys to help the men, he was attacked.

Ashcraft told a Cincinnati television station, â€œOnce I was on the ground, they just kicked me in the face a couple times until I was unconscious. It was my guess an hour to an hour-and-a-half later before I woke up and, from what Iâ€™m told, crawled back to the bar where I was found laying behind the bar.â€

While one reason for the increase in the number of attacks may be that people, like in rape cases, are not as afraid today to come forward to report the crime, the bottom line is that ONE attack is ONE attack too many! I hope the bastards that get a cheap thrill out of beating people for being different (or beating, in general) get what they deserve and much more.

The violence has to stop!

â€œPush Comes To Shove 43 Years Ago â€” The Stonewall Riots: https://anthonypeoples.wordpress.com/2012/06/27/push-comes-to-shove-43-years-ago-the-stonewall-riots/
